meanings.definition: Formed or arranged in an arch shape between two other arches.
meanings.sent1: The interarched design of the bridge made it both sturdy and elegant.
meanings.sent2: The hallway had an interarched ceiling that added a unique touch to the architecture.
meanings.sent3: The interarched windows in the house gave it a charming and cozy feel.
meanings.sent4: The interarched branches of the tree intertwined beautifully in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The interarched pattern on the floor created a mesmerizing optical illusion.

meanings.definition: To connect or link arches together.
meanings.sent1: The mason carefully interarched the stones to create a stable structure.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins showed how they used to interarch the columns for support.
meanings.sent3: The children tried to interarch their toy blocks to build a mini castle.
meanings.sent4: She had to interarch the metal pieces to form the base of the sculpture.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith would interarch the iron bars to craft intricate gates.
